00030 /// A class that creates and tracks ManagedFiles in a particular directory

00032 /// A class that creates and tracks ManagedFiles in a particular directory.
00033 /// The files in this directory are reference-counted by ManagedFileContext
00034 /// and moved, deleted, or copied as needed.
00035 ///
00036 /// Classes that are using ManagedFiles need to be careful to release all
00037 /// references to them when they are finished.  When a ManagedFileContext
00038 /// is destroyed by going out of scope or being deleted it will throw
00039 /// an exception if any references to files in that context remain.
00040 class ManagedFileContext : public SeqBlockContext
00041 {
00042 public:
00043    ManagedFileContext(std::string dir);
00044    ManagedFileContext(Loader& loader);
00045 
00046    /// Free the context, throwing an exception if references to its files are live
00047    ~ManagedFileContext();
00048 
00049    /// Get a reference suitable for use in this context
00050    ManagedFile* GetRef(ManagedFile *file);
00051 
00052    void ReleaseRef(ManagedFile *file);
00053 
00054    /// Move or copy all files to a new directory
00055    void MoveToNewDirectory(std::string dir);
00056 
00057    /// Lock the given set of files in this context.
00058    void LockFiles(std::set<ManagedFile*> filesToCommit);
00059 
00060    /// Allow this context to delete itself when all its files are abandoned
00061    void Release();
00062 
00063    virtual void Store(Storer& storer);
00064    virtual void Store(Storer& storer, std::string relativePath, std::set<ManagedFile*> filesToStore);
00065 
00066    //
00067    // These methods come from SeqBlockContext
00068    //
00069 
00070    // not thread-safe!
00071    SeqBlock *NewSeqBlock(Buffer buffer);
00072 
00073    /// Get a reference that is suitable for use in this context, whether the
00074    /// given SeqBlock is from this context or not.  In practice this will add
00075    /// one to the refcount and return the same block if the given block is from
00076    /// this context, otherwise it will make a copy in this context.
00077    /// This method must be called from the disk thread, because it does a lot
00078    /// of serious disk I/O.
00079    SeqBlock *GetSeqBlockRef(SeqBlock *block);
00080 
00081    SeqBlock *GetSeqBlockRef(Loader& loader, std::string id);
00082 
00083    /// Free use of a block previously acquired using either NewSeqBlock or GetRef.
00084    /// In practice this will decrement the reference count by one, and delete
00085    /// the block if the reference count hits zero.
00086    void ReleaseSeqBlockRef(SeqBlock *block);
00087 
00088    /// Get the number of SeqBlocks currently allocated in this context.  If the
00089    /// owner of this context thinks that all blocks have been freed but finds
00090    /// that this method returns nonzero, the client knows it leaked some blocks.
00091    int GetNumSeqBlocks();
00092 
00093    void Ref();
00094    void Deref();
00095 
00096    static void LoadBackgroundRequests();
00097 
00098  private:
00099    std::string GenerateFileName(std::string extension);
00100    void AddFileToContext(ManagedFile *file);
00101 
00102    std::set<ManagedFile*> mFiles;
00103    std::string mDir;
00104    int mFileIndex;
00105    int mRefCount;
00106    bool mReleased;
00107 
00108    static std::vector<ManagedFileContext*> mContexts;
00109 };
